review.description: I was walking through the Court Street Festival when a big sign that read "Pork Bellies" caught my attention. The guy behind the grill was nice. He was selling skewers of pork belly for $5 a stick. Each stick came with about 5 cubes of pork that he drizzled maple syrup over (at your request). I thought it was an interesting detour from the typical Brooklyn street fair food, though a little pricey.
review.author: Kenny C.

review.description: Ugh. Taste disgusted me, cashiers were careless, and the meet was obviously made in a huge factory farm; not homemade as they claim. Hopefully this place will shut down, and all of the workers here become homeless
review.author: John S.
